intro: Heterochaenia ensifolia, commonly known as the swordleaf heterochaenia, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its long, narrow leaves that resemble a sword, giving it its common name. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Heterochaenia ensifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks.
